CSImageViewer::pnmHelper

pnmHelper Class Reference

This class contains methods that read and write PNM/PGM/PPM images (color rgb and grey images). More...

Static Private Member Functions

static void writeString (BinaryWriter wr, String s)
 When I do binary writes of strings in C#, is appears that they are stored as ascii counted strings (so the count appears before the string. This function simply writes out the characters in the string.

Detailed Description

This class contains methods that read and write PNM/PGM/PPM images (color rgb and grey images).

Member Function Documentation

static int [] read_ascii_ints (  StreamReader  sr,
int  howMany,
out int  max,
out int  min
)  [static, protected]
 

This function reads ascii integer (8-bits or more) values from a file.

Parameters:
sr is the input image file stream
howMany is the number of values (not bytes) to read
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values as well as min and max will be set

static int [] read_ascii_pgm_file (  String  fname,
out int  w,
out int  h,
out int  min,
out int  max
)  [static, protected]
 

This function reads an ascii gray pgm file.

This type of file is formatted as follows: 

    P2
    w h
    maxval
    v_1 v_2 v_3 . . . v_w*h

Parameters:
fname input image file name
w will be set to the image width
h will be set to the image height
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values (gray) as well as w, h, min, and max will be set

static int [] read_ascii_ppm_file (  String  fname,
out int  w,
out int  h,
out int  min,
out int  max
)  [static, protected]
 

This function reads an ascii color ppm file.

This type of file is formatted as follows: 

    P3
    w h
    maxval
    vr_1 vg_1 vb_1
    vr_2 vg_2 vb_2
    . . .
    vr_w*h vg_w*h vb_w*h

Parameters:
fname input image file name
w will be set to the image width
h will be set to the image height
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values (color) as well as w, h, min, and max will be set

static int [] read_binary_pgm_file (  String  fname,
out int  w,
out int  h,
out int  min,
out int  max
)  [static, protected]
 

This function reads a binary gray pgm file.

This type of file is formatted as follows: 

    P5
    w h
    maxval
    v_1 v_2 v_3 . . . v_w*h
One 8-bit byte per binary value.

Parameters:
fname input image file name
w will be set to the image width
h will be set to the image height
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values (gray) as well as w, h, min, and max will be set

static int [] read_binary_ppm_file (  String  fname,
out int  w,
out int  h,
out int  min,
out int  max
)  [static, protected]
 

This function reads a binary color (rgb, 8-bits per component/24-bits per pixel) ppm file.

This type of file is formatted as follows: 

    P6
    w h
    maxval
    vr_1 vg_1 vb_1 
    vr_2 vg_2 vb_2
    . . .
    vr_w*h vg_w*h vb_w*h
One 8-bit byte per binary value (3 bytes for each RGB value).

Parameters:
fname input image file name
w will be set to the image width
h will be set to the image height
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values (color) as well as w, h, min, and max will be set

static int [] read_pnm_file (  String  fname,
out int  w,
out int  h,
out int  samplesPerPixel,
out int  min,
out int  max
)  [static]
 

This method should be generally used to read any pnm (pgm grey, ppm color) binary or ascii image files.

Returns:
an int array of pixel values; in the case of gray data, each entry is an array value; in the case of color data, the first entry is the red, the second the green, and the third the blue.
Parameters:
fname input image file name
w will be set to image width
h will be set to image height
samplesPerPixel samplesPerPixel[0] will be set to 1 (gray) or 3 (color)
min will be set to min value in image
max will be set to min value in image
Returns:
array of pixel values (rgb or gray) as well as w, h, samplesPerPixel, min, and max will be set

static String readHeader (  StreamReader  sr,
out int  w,
out int  h
)  [static, protected]
 

Read image file header.

Parameters:
sr is the input image stream
w will be set to image width
h will be set to image height
Returns:
string indicating image file type as well as w and h will be set

static void write_binary_pgm_data16 (  String  fname,
int[]  buff,
int  width,
int  height
)  [static]
 

Non-standard function that writes 16-bit values as a binary pgm (gray only) file.

Parameters:
fname input image file name
buff buffer of pixel values to write to the file
width image width
height image height
Returns:
nothing (void)
Todo:
below could be made more efficient by replacing it with fewer, larger buffer writes

int[]  buff,
int  width,
int  height
)  [static]

Parameters:

buff buffer of pixel values to write to the file

height image height
Returns:
nothing (void)

static void write_binary_pgm_or_ppm_data8 (  String  fname,
int[]  buff,
int  width,
int  height,
int  samples_per_pixel
)  [static]
 

Standard functions that writes 8-bit values as a binary pgm (gray) or ppm (color) file.

Parameters:
fname input image file name
buff buffer of pixel values to write to the file
width image width
height image height
samples_per_pixel samples per pixel (1=gray; 3=rgb/color)
Returns:
nothing (void)
Todo:
below could be made more efficient by replacing it with fewer, larger buffer writes

static void write_pgm_or_ppm_ascii_data (  String  fname,
int[]  buff,
int  width,
int  height,
int  samples_per_pixel
)  [static]
 

Standard function that writes values as a pgm (grey) or ppm (color) ascii file.

Parameters:
fname input image file name
buff buffer of pixel values to write to the file
width image width
height image height
samples_per_pixel samples per pixel (1=gray; 3=rgb/color)
Returns:
nothing (void)

static void writeString (  BinaryWriter  wr,
String  s
)  [static, private]
 

When I do binary writes of strings in C#, is appears that they are stored as ascii counted strings (so the count appears before the string. This function simply writes out the characters in the string.

Parameters:
wr output binary stream
s string to write
Returns:
nothing (void)
